parent.translation[0].definitions[0].def: the father or mother of a person or animal
parent.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: Children under 14 should be accompanied by a parent.
The eggs are guarded by both parents.
Melissa’s spending the weekend at her parents’ house.
parent.translation[0].definitions[1].def: something that produces other things of the same type
parent.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: New shoots appear near the parent plant.
parent.translation[0].definitions[2].def: a company which owns a smaller company or organization
parent.translation[0].note_box[0].sectio: My mum is a single parent.
Most children are reared by their natural parents.
Only half the children who are adopted wish to discover their birth parents.
I was thrilled to have found my real parents.
Adoptive parents often have little practical preparation for parenthood.
Teresa was removed from her mother's care and placed with foster parents.
parent.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to look after your child and help them to develop well and learn how to behave
parent.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: We help people to parent their children more effectively.
parent.translation[2].definitions[0].def: if one company is the parent of another, it owns at least half the shares in the other company, and has control over it
parent.translation[2].definitions[0].exa: The Minneapolis-based parent of investment firm Piper announced record revenue and earnings.
This is an opportunity to improve the capital position of both the parent company and its subsidiaries.
